intro: Tricostularia newbeyi, commonly known as the Newbey's tricostularia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with yellow petals and a central disk. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
